title: Cant keep 60 fps
body:
hey everyone i built a new pc and for some reason i cant keep a steady 60 fps. i can lower my graphic settings and i still cant get 60fps dont matter the resolution or graphic settings. so confused. i did all the troubleshooting provided from riot and still nothing. here are my specs. let me know if you have any suggestions

Intel i7 6700k
msi z170a gaming m7
msi gtx 1070
corsair vengeance LPX 2x8g

monitor is
Samsung U28E590D 28-Inch UHD LED-Lit Monitor
using displayport

replies.body:
With that new hardware, I'll assume that you're running Windows 10, which means this may be caused by the Windows Game Bar and its *Game DVR* functionality. This feature has been causing FPS issues and system freezes for the occasional player since the feature was becoming automatically enabled through some recent Windows updates. I'd strongly recommend going through [**this guide**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to ensure this feature is disabled and can't contribute to your issues.

Let me know if this caused any change for you.
did that already. did not help

Gotcha. In that case, we'll need to ensure you're running a properly installed and updated display driver and that none of your Windows power settings among other small important settings are configured correctly for League. Our [**FPS Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) will walk you through the steps I'd suggest taking at this point.

Hit me up with the results of those steps.

If I may give a poke here...it feels like the system requirements are a bit outdated in these 4K-times. 
Exactly what kind of hardware is needed to get 60 FPS minimum - or even 120/144 FPS with the appropriate monitor - on a 1440p/4K setup?

I'm curious, as I'm running
-Asus Sabertooth Z77
-i7 3770K
-32 GB RAM (4 x 8 dual-channel)
-EVGA GTX 1080 FTW
-Dedicated SSDs for OS (Intel 540 240 GB), Games (Samsung 840 PRO 512 GB) and temp-files (to reduce OS SSD wear - Intel 520 60 GB). All drives in 90+ % health.
-Windows 7 Ultimate
-Asus Essence STX
-Asus DSL-AC68U modem + all-wired Cat. 6 STP-cables and Netgear unmanaged switches

Custom Performance power-settings, disabled Aero and various, unneeded services etc.
_I would claim that I know what I'm doing._

I run LoL on max graphics (naturally). And to be perfectly honest, I should not have to lower them.

Fair enough, I know my CPU is on the mid-end of things these days, but even with _that_ GPU as backup, I am occasionally seeing sub-120 FPS (to be fair, only in the heaviest of clusterfucks, if you'll excuse the expression).

It's a non-issue for now, as I'm only using a 60 Hz monitor, but when I'm doing my next build, maybe sooner, I'll likely get a monitor to match.
And a minimum FPS of ~100 will not likely cut it when that time comes.

I got a minimum FPS of ~85 in Doom 4 on max graphics with that GTX 1080, and I doubt this game would ever be as demanding as that.
_...Yet the FPS counter does want to say different._

TL;DR:
Is the CPU deciding the performance of this game _that_ much, or is the issue elsewhere?

With regard to the GTX 10XX graphics cards, the Pascal chip didn't like LoL very much until Geforce driver 376.19 (newest at the time).
Even my GTX 1080 struggled - and even failed - to get 60 FPS on occasion, so if you run any earlier drivers than that, update them ASAP!

http://www.geforce.com/drivers

I know it seems like a simple task, but make sure your drivers are up to date for your monitor. I got a new Samsung monitor for Christmas and it was running the game at 5 fps, but reverted back to 120 once I updated the display drivers and restarted. Hope it's fixed!
